prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism The first part is a rectangular prism with a square base and a rectangular top. Creating the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. The euler angles for this coordinate system are [0.0, 0.0, -90.0], and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.5, 0.25]. This will position the prism with its base on the x-y plane, and its center at (0, 0.5, 0.25). Drawing the Sketch Next, draw the 2D sketch for part 1 on the plane defined by the coordinate system. * Start by drawing the bottom-left line of the square base, extending from (0, 0) to (0.75, 0). * From the endpoint (0.75, 0), draw the next line extending upwards to (0.75, 0.3866). * Continue by drawing the line extending from (0.75, 0.3866) rightwards to (0.5, 0.3866). * Draw the line from (0.5, 0.3866) downwards to (0.5, 0.2616). * Continue by drawing the line from (0.5, 0.2616) leftwards to (0.25, 0.2616). * From (0.25, 0.2616), draw the next line upwards to (0.25, 0.375). * Next, draw the line from (0.25, 0.375) rightwards to (0.0, 0.375). * Finally, draw the last line extending back from (0.0, 0.375) to (0.0, 0.0) to close the loop. Scaling the Sketch Scale the sketch by 0.75 before transforming into 3D Sketch. Transforming 2D Sketch into 3D Sketch using Euler Angles and Translation Vector Transform the 2D sketch using the euler angles (-90, 0, 0) and the translation vector [0, 0.1134, 0]. This will position the scaled sketch for part 1 in its correct location. Extruding the 2D Sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.25 units to create the 3D model for part 1. Use `NewBodyFeatureOperation` as the operation for the extrusion. The prism has the following dimensions: - Height: 0.25 units - Width: 0.75 units - Length: 0.25 units This concludes the instructions for part 1.</description>
